00021 /*! \file
00022  *
00023  * \brief DNS Support for Asterisk
00024  *
00025  * \author Thorsten Lockert <tholo@trollphone.org>
00026  *
00027  * \par Reference
00028  * - DNR SRV records http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2782.txt
00029  *
00030  */
00031 
00032 #include "asterisk.h"
00033 
00034 ASTERISK_FILE_VERSION(__FILE__, "$Revision$")
00035 
00036 #include <sys/types.h>
00037 #include <sys/socket.h>
00038 #include <netinet/in.h>
00039 #include <arpa/nameser.h>
00040 #include <resolv.h>
00041 #include <unistd.h>
00042 
00043 #include "asterisk/logger.h"
00044 #include "asterisk/channel.h"
00045 #include "asterisk/dns.h"
00046 #include "asterisk/endian.h"
00047 #include "asterisk/options.h"
00048 
00049 #define MAX_SIZE 4096
00050 
00051 #ifdef __PDP_ENDIAN
00052 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __PDP_ENDIAN
00053 #define DETERMINED_BYTE_ORDER __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00054 #endif
00055 #endif
00056 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __BIG_ENDIAN
00057 #define DETERMINED_BYTE_ORDER __BIG_ENDIAN
00058 #endif
00059 #if __BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00060 #define DETERMINED_BYTE_ORDER __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00061 #endif
00062 
00063 typedef struct {
00064    unsigned id:16;          /*!< query identification number */
00065 #if DETERMINED_BYTE_ORDER == __BIG_ENDIAN
00066          /* fields in third byte */
00067    unsigned qr:1;           /*!< response flag */
00068    unsigned opcode:4;       /*!< purpose of message */
00069    unsigned aa:1;           /*!< authoritive answer */
00070    unsigned tc:1;           /*!< truncated message */
00071    unsigned rd:1;           /*!< recursion desired */
00072          /* fields in fourth byte */
00073    unsigned ra:1;           /*!< recursion available */
00074    unsigned unused:1;       /*!< unused bits (MBZ as of 4.9.3a3) */
00075    unsigned ad:1;           /*!< authentic data from named */
00076    unsigned cd:1;           /*!< checking disabled by resolver */
00077    unsigned rcode:4;        /*!< response code */
00078 #endif
00079 #if DETERMINED_BYTE_ORDER == __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00080          /* fields in third byte */
00081    unsigned rd:1;           /*!< recursion desired */
00082    unsigned tc:1;           /*!< truncated message */
00083    unsigned aa:1;           /*!< authoritive answer */
00084    unsigned opcode:4;       /*!< purpose of message */
00085    unsigned qr:1;           /*!< response flag */
00086          /* fields in fourth byte */
00087    unsigned rcode:4;        /*!< response code */
00088    unsigned cd:1;           /*!< checking disabled by resolver */
00089    unsigned ad:1;           /*!< authentic data from named */
00090    unsigned unused:1;       /*!< unused bits (MBZ as of 4.9.3a3) */
00091    unsigned ra:1;           /*!< recursion available */
00092 #endif
00093          /* remaining bytes */
00094    unsigned qdcount:16;     /*!< number of question entries */
00095    unsigned ancount:16;     /*!< number of answer entries */
00096    unsigned nscount:16;     /*!< number of authority entries */
00097    unsigned arcount:16;     /*!< number of resource entries */
00098 } dns_HEADER;
00099 
00100 struct dn_answer {
00101    unsigned short rtype;
00102    unsigned short class;
00103    unsigned int ttl;
00104    unsigned short size;
00105 } __attribute__ ((__packed__));
00106 
00107 static int skip_name(unsigned char *s, int len)
00108 {
00109    int x = 0;
00110 
00111    while (x < len) {
00112       if (*s == '\0') {
00113          s++;
00114          x++;
00115          break;
00116       }
00117       if ((*s & 0xc0) == 0xc0) {
00118          s += 2;
00119          x += 2;
00120          break;
00121       }
00122       x += *s + 1;
00123       s += *s + 1;
00124    }
00125    if (x >= len)
00126       return -1;
00127    return x;
00128 }
00129 
00130 /*! \brief Parse DNS lookup result, call callback */
00131 static int dns_parse_answer(void *context,
00132    int class, int type, unsigned char *answer, int len,
00133    int (*callback)(void *context, unsigned char *answer, int len, unsigned char *fullanswer))
00134 {
00135    unsigned char *fullanswer = answer;
00136    struct dn_answer *ans;
00137    dns_HEADER *h;
00138    int res;
00139    int x;
00140 
00141    h = (dns_HEADER *)answer;
00142    answer += sizeof(dns_HEADER);
00143    len -= sizeof(dns_HEADER);
00144 
00145    for (x = 0; x < ntohs(h->qdcount); x++) {
00146       if ((res = skip_name(answer, len)) < 0) {
00147          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Couldn't skip over name\n");
00148          return -1;
00149       }
00150       answer += res + 4;   /* Skip name and QCODE / QCLASS */
00151       len -= res + 4;
00152       if (len < 0) {
00153          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Strange query size\n");
00154          return -1;
00155       }
00156    }
00157 
00158    for (x = 0; x < ntohs(h->ancount); x++) {
00159       if ((res = skip_name(answer, len)) < 0) {
00160          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed skipping name\n");
00161          return -1;
00162       }
00163       answer += res;
00164       len -= res;
00165       ans = (struct dn_answer *)answer;
00166       answer += sizeof(struct dn_answer);
00167       len -= sizeof(struct dn_answer);
00168       if (len < 0) {
00169          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Strange result size\n");
00170          return -1;
00171       }
00172       if (len < 0) {
00173          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Length exceeds frame\n");
00174          return -1;
00175       }
00176 
00177       if (ntohs(ans->class) == class && ntohs(ans->rtype) == type) {
00178          if (callback) {
00179             if ((res = callback(context, answer, ntohs(ans->size), fullanswer)) < 0) {
00180                ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to parse result\n");
00181                return -1;
00182             }
00183             if (res > 0)
00184                return 1;
00185          }
00186       }
00187       answer += ntohs(ans->size);
00188       len -= ntohs(ans->size);
00189    }
00190    return 0;
00191 }
00192 
00193 #ifndef HAVE_RES_NINIT
00194 AST_MUTEX_DEFINE_STATIC(res_lock);
00195 #endif
00196 
00197 /*! \brief Lookup record in DNS 
00198 \note Asterisk DNS is synchronus at this time. This means that if your DNS does
00199 not work properly, Asterisk might not start properly or a channel may lock.
00200 */
00201 int ast_search_dns(void *context,
00202       const char *dname, int class, int type,
00203       int (*callback)(void *context, unsigned char *answer, int len, unsigned char *fullanswer))
00204 {
00205 #ifdef HAVE_RES_NINIT
00206    struct __res_state dnsstate;
00207 #endif
00208    unsigned char answer[MAX_SIZE];
00209    int res, ret = -1;
00210 
00211 #ifdef HAVE_RES_NINIT
00212    res_ninit(&dnsstate);
00213    res = res_nsearch(&dnsstate, dname, class, type, answer, sizeof(answer));
00214 #else
00215    ast_mutex_lock(&res_lock);
00216    res_init();
00217    res = res_search(dname, class, type, answer, sizeof(answer));
00218 #endif
00219    if (res > 0) {
00220       if ((res = dns_parse_answer(context, class, type, answer, res, callback)) < 0) {
00221          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "DNS Parse error for %s\n", dname);
00222          ret = -1;
00223       }
00224       else if (ret == 0) {
00225          if (option_debug)
00226             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "No matches found in DNS for %s\n", dname);
00227          ret = 0;
00228       }
00229       else
00230          ret = 1;
00231    }
00232 #ifdef HAVE_RES_NINIT
00233    res_nclose(&dnsstate);
00234 #else
00235 #ifndef __APPLE__
00236    res_close();
00237 #endif
00238    ast_mutex_unlock(&res_lock);
00239 #endif
00240 
00241    return ret;
00242 }
